Items.applicationNameText:
Application is a functional ensemble of IT systems (according to ITIL: Configuration Item [CI]) with direct integration into the supported business process.
The application name is unique within all IT systems. To do this e.g. for SAP systems the name is built from SID like P69 concatenated with the client and Company Code like P69M600C1251
Items.applicationAliasText: A secondary name for an application by which it is also known.
Items.barApplicationIdText: The application ident for an application defined by the Bayer Application Register.
Items.versionText: Version of the application with the name in "application name" and not the version of additional software packages.
Items.applicationCat2Text: IT related category for the primarily used technology in the application.
Items.lifecycleStatusText:
The lifecycle status defines the status of a CI in the course of its existence, from planning to scrapping.
The lifecycle status can be subdivided into lifecycle substatuses.
Items.operationalStatusText:
The deployment status of a CI specifies the purpose for which the CI is used, independently of its lifecycle status. The values are defined with the following definitions:
  • Development: CI does not affect the customer’s business processes or any service processes of the IT service provider except “development”.
  • QA: CI does not affect the customer’s business processes or any service processes of the IT service provider except “quality assurance”.
  • Production: CI does affect the customer’s business processes or the service processes of the IT service provider.
  • Sandbox: CI is used in a test with the customer’s involvement.
  • Test: CI is used in a test without the customer’s involvement.
Items.commentsText: Information that cannot be placed into other attributes but which carries valuable details, even in an unstructured form.
Items.applicationBusinessCatText: Categorization in terms of business, which the application is supporting
Items.dataClassText: Categorization of standard data classes to match the data wich is processed in the business process regarding the selected business category
Items.businessProcessText: Categorization of standard data classes to match the data wich is processed in the business process regarding the selected business category

Items.applicationOwnerDelegateText: "Application Steward has been defined per legal entity and is resp. for data quality (company code) Will be defined by Application Owner Business."

Items.ciSubResponsibleText: Person or group delegated ("Substitute") by the CI Owner to be ciResponsible for the accuracy of the CI record data.

Items.gpsccontactChangeTeamText: Group responsible for initiating and investigating and deploying changes with this CI assigned

Items.gpsccontactServiceCoordinatorIndivText: Individual(s) required for communication with special clients
Items.gpsccontactEscalationText: Group who can be contacted in the event of an escalation for the CI
Items.gpsccontactEscalationIndivText: Individual(s) who can be contacted in the event of an escalation for the CI
Items.gpsccontactImpactedBusinessText: Business group where the majority of belonging companies is using the application
Items.gpsccontactOwningBusinessGroupText: Business group (subgroup or company or group of companies) whose members are authorizing changes of the CI and also changes in the strategic attributs like disaster recovery level and information classification and data privacy

Items.slaNameText:
An SLA is a core component in a contract between an IT service provider and a service recipient, whether within the company or outside.
It specifies the terms on which the services are sold, as defined from the contractor’s point of view. The following parameters are defined for each service:
  • scope of functions,
  • relevant quality features,
  • availability periods,
  • service periods,
  • limit values,
  • costs and
  • safeguards
in the event of non-observance.
It is also possible to specify the customer’s duties, e.g. the provision of rooms. A distinction must be made between an SLA under the contract (target) and an SLA in the operational documentation (actual, seen from the contractor’s point of view). Differences can occur through the standardization of operational routines or experience values of the contractor in dealing with the supported business processes.
Items.priorityLevelText: Value assigned to a CI to be used for a CI-related incident, problem or change in order to indicate the importance and time frame. This may be independent of the SLA related to the CI and is defined by the CI Owner, sometimes also called "Provider's Response Level".
Items.serviceContractText: Values are reliant on the chosen SLA. Definition according to Asset Manager and Service Portal.
Items.severityLevelText: Value assigned to an incident, problem or change in order to indicate the importance and time frame. Severities are derived from the impact and urgency.
Items.businessEssentialText:
Generally, IT services with service level peculiarity of ‘business critical’ can be defined as being essential to customer’s business. All Configuration Items (CIs) whose failure could cause a failure of an business process inherit the ‘essential’ characteristic if the supported business process is named by the customer as ‘essential’.
In order to profit as much as possible from this process, a business continuity plan should exist on customer’s side for essential business processes that addresses the situation that the business process is disturbed or interrupted, e.g. an essential IT service fails and cannot be restored in reasonable time.

A severe failure of an essential CI will activate the incident escalation process.
Items.itSecSbAppProtectionText:
Maximum IT security level for confidentiality and integrity of the content accessible via the application.
Possible values according to the relevant group regulations:
  • Public
  • Protected
  • Strictly Protected
Items.itSecSbAvailabilityIdText:
Maximum IT security Level for the availability of the content accessible via the application.
Possible values are high, medium and low
Items.itSecSbAvailabilityDescriptionText: An explanatory statement to the chosen availability status.
Items.protectionClassInformationText: The information classification according to GR1435
Items.protectionClassInformationExplanationTex: An explanatory statement to the chosen information class
Items.itsetNameText:
Region where the majority of belonging companies is using the application. The IT set is automatically calculated by the location-membership of the CI owner.
IT set is used within BYTsec as a client, comparable with a SAP client. Each BYTsec object is assigned to only one IT set, a BYTsec user may be assigned to one or more IT sets.
Items.isTemplateText: Make this CI a template in order to use the given compliance statements for other CIs. (BYTsec)
Items.referencedTemplateText:
Reference to a template-CI.
If a reference is used, all given compliance statements within the template will are used for the current CI also.
Items.itsecGroupText:
The ITSec group is an instance in the BBS IT architecture model of the “object group” level. ITSec groups contain safeguards that are to be implemented for a given CI with a specific security relevance.
Distinctions are made by CI types, security-related CI properties and levels of security/protection.
Items.relevanceGR1435Text:
Specifies whether a CI is GR1435 relevant or not.
If "yes" an ITSec group must be assigned to the CI.
Items.relevanceGR1775Text:
Specifies whether a CI is GR1775 relevant or not.
If "yes" an ITSec group must be assigned to the CI.
Items.relevanceGR1920Text:
Specifies whether a CI is ICS relevant or not.
If "yes" an ITSec group must be assigned to the CI.
Items.relevanceGR2008Text:
Specifies whether a CI is GR2008 relevant or not.
If "yes" an ITSec group must be assigned to the CI.
Items.gxpFlagText: Specifies whether a CI is GxP relevant or not.
Items.riskAnalysisYNText: Defines the availability of a formal risk analysis according to GR1775 or GR2008.
Items.licenseTypeText: Specification of general properties of a license, the extent or part of contractual provisions.
Items.applicationAccessingUserCountText:
Number of users using the CI with relevance for the licensing.
Depending on the license model, this can be the total amount of registered users, number of concurrent users or not necessary.
Items.applicationAccessingUserCountMeasuredTex: Meßwert zu “Accessing User Count”, d.h. tatsächlich verbrauchte Lizenzen
Items.dedicatedText:
“Dedicated” bedeutet, dass mit dem Kunden vereinbart ist, dass seine Anwendung alleine auf einer SPL läuft.
“Shared” bedeutet, dass mit dem Kunden vereinbart ist, dass seine Anwendung zusammen mit mindestens einer weiteren Anwendung auf einer SPL läuft.
Items.loadClassText: Lastklasse in Bezug auf “gefühlten Verbrauch” von CPU/RAM/Disk pro aufgerufener Instanz. Die Definition der Lastklassen befindet sich im GPC unter den Produkten
Items.serviceModelText: Service model contains information of licensing and how the application is run. Example: Application Hosting or SaaS Service model according definition of licencing community: The service model defines the responsibility concerning software licences between provider & customer. LCO has decided that this is a Bayer mandatory attribute.
Items.currencyText: The currency of the indicated costs.
Items.runAccountText: Account to be charged for running costs
Items.changeAccountText: Account to be charged for change process costs
Items.supportstuffAppDocText: Link to the application documentation (user guide)
Items.supportstuffUASupportingDocText: Link to a user authorization supporting document; e.g. operating manual.
Items.supportstuffUAProcessText: Link to a document describing the user authorization process.
Items.supportstuffCMSupportingToolText: Name of or URL to a tool supporting the change management process.
Items.supportstuffUMProcessText: Link to a document describing the user management process.
